attributes.action: Repeal of the iniquitous UK/US extradition law
attributes.additional_details:
Under the 2003 US-UK Extradition Treaty, if the UK seeks to extradite a person from the US prima facie evidence that "the person sought committed the offense for which extradition is requested" must first be provided.    If the US wishes to extradite a preson from the UK no such evidence is required and UK courts are powerless to prevent it.

This is a wholly unjust and unfair situation which must be stopped, irrespective of any threats or objections raised from the US.

A new treaty must be introduced imposing equivalent rights and responsibilities on both parties.
